intro: Ruellia lupulina, commonly known as the black-leaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators like bees and hummingbirds. Ruellia lupulina is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its striking foliage and bloom.
